awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Block Travel Support to 1988 IAMP    Congress
awd_abstract_narration: This project will provide partial travel support to                        enable young U.S. scientists to attend the forthcoming                          Congress of the International Association of                                    Mathematical Physics in Swansea, Great Britain in July                          of 1988.  It is anticipated that partial support for                            fifteen young investigators will be provided under this                         project.                                                                             The research sessions at the Congress will include                         general relativity, probabilistic methods and stochastic                        mechanics, the mathematics of string theory, conformally                        invariant field theories, classical mechanics, classical                        field theory, operator algebras, mathematical problems                          in condensed matter physics, dynamical systems and                              chaos, the general theory of quantum mechanics, and                             other topics in mathematical physics.                                                The travel grant will be administered through the                          Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences located at                           New York University
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
